text: We'll hear argument now in No. 91-7604, Jeffery Antoine v. Byers & Anderson.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court:
Although you could certainly say that's a ministerial sort of act, couldn't you?
Let me answer your first question, and that is whether this judge's certification might be deemed to be ministerial.
In that particular situation, that would come somewhat close to Forrester, of a hiring and firing decision which may be an administrative act rather than a judicial act by the judge.
But in any event, there would be qualified immunity.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court:
It was Professor Langbein of Chicago.
At that time, now moved to Yale, as I understand.
Thank you... thank you, Ms. McKeown.
